description:
Candidatus Cetobacterium colombiensis is a newly discovered, uncultured bacterial species that was first identified in the gut microbiome of freshwater fish from Colombia, South America. It belongs to the phylum Firmicutes and the family Erysipelotrichaceae.

This bacterial species is considered a "Candidatus" species, which means it has been detected and characterized based on genomic data, but has not yet been successfully cultured in a laboratory setting. The name "Cetobacterium colombiensis" reflects its identification from Colombian freshwater fish species.

Genomic analysis suggests that Candidatus Cetobacterium colombiensis is an anaerobic, Gram-positive bacterium that may play a role in the digestion and metabolism of nutrients within the fish gut microbiome. Its presence and potential functions within the fish gut ecosystem are an active area of ongoing research, as scientists seek to better understand the complex microbial communities associated with various aquatic organisms.
prompt: Provide a short scientific description of this species: Candidatus Cetobacterium colombiensis
